content.body: Is there a reason why the destructuring pattern `{...{}}` is disallowed with an early error, while `[...{}]` is allowed?
The inconsistency annoys me, but I cannot think of a real reason to allow it in object destructuring (maybe "I want to trigger every getter"?)
But that will get removed by virtually all optimizers
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But that will get removed by virtually all optimizers

content.body: there's a bunch of annoying places parens are required around an object literal, i assume because of the ambiguity with block statements

content.body: I meant a standalone "assumed no side effect" expression like this will often get removed by minifiers, the same way `foo.bar` will. Basically if the goal is to "trigger getters", minifiers will usually get rid of any such constructs.

content.body: I’d still call that a broken minifier
similar incorrect expectations caused rollup to break Airbnb.com on IE for a month, a few years back
I feel like, if I could get away with breaking IE support for a month without getting angry phone calls, I would do it and then tell management it's clearly not actually important to support
